snippet: Irene Bernatzky, 88, died on Tuesday after she fell down the escalator at the Lindenhurst station of the Long Island Rail Road.
abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority officials are investigating the death of 88-year-old Irene Bernatzky, who fell down an escalator at the Lindenhurst station of the Long Island Railroad; riders who use the station say the two-story escalator has had problems for a long time and MTA officials report that they had proposed replacing it in 2008.

byline.original: By CHRISTINE HAUGHNEY and IVAN PEREIRA

lead_paragraph: Irene Bernatzky, 88, died on Tuesday after she fell down the escalator at the Lindenhurst station of the Long Island Rail Road.

headline.seo: Woman, 88, Dies on Escalator at L.I.R.R. Station
headline.main: Death on Escalator M.T.A. Had Once Hoped to Replace
headline.print_headline: Death on Escalator M.T.A. Had Once Hoped to Replace
